content: <metadata>   <idinfo>     <citation>       <citeinfo>         <pubdate>20150208</pubdate>         <title>Land Use</title>         <edition>2014 Land Use</edition>         <geoform>vector digital data</geoform>       </citeinfo>     </citation>     <descript>       <abstract>This layer represents existing land use by parcel. The data were compiled from the Assessor's parcel records and evaluated through the period of April to December 2014 - in many cases the April 2014 aerial imagery was referenced to determine use.</abstract>       <purpose>This layer was created to identify and track existing land use throughout Denver specifically for the Community Planning and Development department. It generalizes the Assessor's tax classifications of parcels into caterogries specific to planning.</purpose>     </descript>     <status>       <update>As needed</update>     </status>     <spdom>       <bounding>         <westbc>-105.109833</westbc>         <eastbc>-104.599538</eastbc>         <northbc>39.914196</northbc>         <southbc>39.612739</southbc>       </bounding>     </spdom>     <keywords>       <theme>         <themekt>None</themekt>         <themekey>planning</themekey>         <themekey>property</themekey>       </theme>       <theme>         <themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Categories</themekt>         <themekey>boundaries</themekey>         <themekey>planningCadastre</themekey>       </theme>       <place>         <placekt>None</placekt>         <placekey>Denver</placekey>         <placekey>Denver County</placekey>         <placekey>Colorado</placekey>         <placekey>USA</placekey>       </place>     </keywords>     <accconst>None</accconst>     <useconst>ACCESS CONSTRAINTS:   None.   USE CONSTRAINTS: The City and County of Denver is not responsible and shall not be liable to the user for damages of any kind arising out of the use of data or information provided by the City and County of Denver, including the installation of the data or information, its use, or the results obtained from its use.   ANY DATA OR INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE City and County of Denver IS PROVIDED "AS IS" WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  Data or information provided by the City and County of Denver shall be used and relied upon only at the user's sole risk, and the user agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the City and County of Denver, its officials, officers and employees from any liability arising out of the use of the data/information provided.   NOT FOR ENGINEERING PURPOSES </useconst>     <datacred>City and County of Denver, Community Planning and Development</datacred>     <secinfo>       <secsys>AVAILABLE</secsys>       <secclass>Unclassified</secclass>       <sechandl>Available to the public and accessible through the Denver\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Open Data Catalog, http://data.denvergov.org/</sechandl>     </secinfo>     <native>Microsoft Windows Server 2008 R2 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcGIS 10.0.5.4400</native>   </idinfo>   <dataqual />   <spdoinfo>     <direct>Vector</direct>     <ptvctinf>       <sdtsterm>         <sdtstype>GT-polygon composed of chains</sdtstype>         <ptvctcnt>175713</ptvctcnt>       </sdtsterm>     </ptvctinf>   </spdoinfo>   <spref>     <horizsys>       <geograph>         <latres>8.9831528411952133e-009</latres>         <longres>8.9831528411952133e-009</longres>         <geogunit>Decimal Degrees</geogunit>       </geograph>       <geodetic>         <horizdn>D WGS 1984</horizdn>         <ellips>WGS 1984</ellips>         <semiaxis>6378137.0</semiaxis>         <denflat>298.257223563</denflat>       </geodetic>     </horizsys>   </spref>   <eainfo>     <detailed>       <enttyp>         <enttypl>PLAN_EXISTINGLANDUSE_A</enttypl>       </enttyp>       <attr>         <attrlabl>OBJECTID</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Internal feature number.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>         <attrdomv>           <udom>Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.</udom>         </attrdomv>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>SHAPE</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Feature geometry.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>         <attrdomv>           <udom>Coordinates defining the features.</udom>         </attrdomv>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>SCHEDNUM</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Assessor parcel identification key.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Assessment Division</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>D_CLASS_CN</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Assessor tax classification.  Used as base to identify land uses, included as reference. </attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Assessment Division</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>DESC_NOTES</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Any additional descriptions or notes that may help define land use or clarify discrepancies in data. </attrdef>         <attrdefs>Community Planning and Development</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>CPD_LU_II</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Community Planning and Development Land Use Level II.  This is a more detailed level of land use that my be used to identify more specific uses.  </attrdef>         <attrdefs>Community Planning and Development</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>CPD_LU_I</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Community Planning and Development Land Use Level I.  This is a more generalized level of land use that may be used in mapping at the citywide level.  </attrdef>         <attrdefs>Community Planning and Development</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>Stories</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Pulled initially from Assessor tables to identify the number of stories or floors in the primary building on the parcel.  This field is often unknown and left as 0 despite presence of a building.  In some cases, the value has been modified or populated using other data sources, such as Google or Bing. </attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Assessment Division / Community Planning and Development</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>Units</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Pulled initially from Assessor tables to identify the number of units on the parcel.  Where there are mutliple primary buildings, the units are aggregated for the parcel.  This field is often unknown and left as 0 despite presence of a building.  In some cases, the value has been modified or populated using other data sources, such as permit data. </attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Assessment Division / Community Planning and Development</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>GlobalID</attrlabl>         <attrdef>A field of type UUID (Universal Unique Identifier) in which values are automatically assigned by the geodatabase when a row is created. The GlobalID field is necessary for maintaining object uniqueness across replicas. All feature classes and tables participating in one-way or two-way replication must contain the GlobalID field. This field is not editable and is automatically populated when it is added for existing data. </attrdef>         <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>SHAPE_Length</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Length of feature in internal units.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>         <attrdomv>           <udom>Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.</udom>         </attrdomv>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>SHAPE_Area</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Area of feature in internal units squared.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>         <attrdomv>           <udom>Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.</udom>         </attrdomv>       </attr>     </detailed>   </eainfo>   <distinfo>     <distrib>       <cntinfo>         <cntorgp>           <cntorg>City and County of Denver, Technology Services / Enterprise Data Management</cntorg>         </cntorgp>         <cntaddr>           <addrtype>unknown</addrtype>           <address>201 W Colfax Ave, Dept 301</address>           <city>Denver</city>           <state>CO</state>           <postal>80202</postal>           <country>USA</country>         </cntaddr>         <cntemail>denvergis@denvergov.org</cntemail>         <hours>M-F 8:00am - 4:00pm (MT)</hours>       </cntinfo>     </distrib>     <distliab>See access and use constraints information.</distliab>   </distinfo>   <metainfo>     <metd>20150308</metd>     <metstdn>FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata</metstdn>     <metstdv>FGDC-STD-001-1998</metstdv>     <mettc>local time</mettc>   </metainfo> </metadata>
